posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Good Aim has nothing to do with bows.  That's for throwing weapons like sling, darts, etc.  Small size is what you should be comparing vs. elf.  For that matter, even gnome would work since there is no chance of XP penalty with that combo.  +1 AB/+1 AC for size.  Also, small size gains +4 skill checks for stealth and detection vs. medium hostiles so if sneaking is a major concern, go small.  Else, elf's Keen Sense can be HUGE if there are deadly and epic traps around.  Even if you can't disarm epics, you can send a sacrificial summon to trigger it, once spotted.

TBH, high rogue or high assassin means you're commiting to sneak damage (or DA which is about the same thing damage-wise) so that small amount of STR damage means almost nothing.  Just like any Dexer, if you can't crit you will be relying on FEs for damage anyway.  Just set the STR to about the level where you can manage toting loot comfortably and that's about enough.  BTW, low STR doesn't affect saves but low CON (per elf) does.

But except for the small stature benefits, unless you are starting with either 19 or 20 DEX, there is nothing to be gained beyond human except for those hin/elf racial goodies at the cost of a feat and 40 skill points.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: With Halfling or Elf, you can get to 18 DEX with 6 fewer points spent, which you can then put in other abilities. That is still an advantage over Human, but maybe not worth the loss of a feat and 43 (not just 40) skill,points.
